transcript.title: FOR PRESS: P.M.NO. 29/1967 VISIT OF HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS THE DUKE OF EDINBURGH STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, MR. HAROLD HOLT
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS: P. M No. 29/ 1967
VISIT OF HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS THE DUKE OF
EDINBUR GH
Staten~ ent by the Prime Minister, Mr. Harold Holt
Details of the programme prepared for his Visit to
Australia, between March 1st and 10th, have now been approved by His Royal
Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. While a great deal of Prince Philip's time will be taken
up with meetings associated with the Duke of Edinburgh's Third Commonwealth
Study Conference, to be held in Australia in 1968, he has several othe r
engagements of a public and official kind and will visit some of the fire
disaster areas in Tasmania. His Royal Highness is scheduled to arrive at the RAAF
Base, Fairbairn ( Canberra) at 11. 00 p. m. on Wednesday. March 1st, after
flying in an RAF Comet aircraft from Singapore via Darwin. While in
Canberra, he will stay at Government House.
On Thursday morning March 2nd. at Government
House, he will attend the inaugural meeting of the Australian Outward Bound
Trust, and also have talks with members of the Third Commonwealth Study
Conference. In the afternoon he will attend a televised Press
Conference at Government House, in connection with the Study Conference,
and in the evening will attend a Parliamentary Reception at Parliament House.
Afterwards His Royal Highness will be present at a Dinner at Government
House. On Friday morning at 9. 30 a. in., he will fly from
Canberra to Melbourne in an RAAF Viscount aircraft.
The itinerary for the Visit is:-
Wednesday, 1st 11.00 p. m. Arrive at Canberra by RAF Comet
from Singapore via Darwin.
Thursday, 2nd In Canberra
Friday, 3rd Morning Leave Canberra for Melbourne
Saturday, 4th In Melbourne
Sunday, 5th In Melbourne
Monday, 6th Morning Leave Melbourne for Tasmania
Tuesday, 7th Morning Leave Tasmania for Melbourne
Wednesday, 8th Morning Leave Melbourne for Sydney
Thursday, 9th In Sydney
Friday, 10th Morning Leave Sydney by RAF Comet for
Singapore via Darwin.
CANBERRA, 15th February, 1967
BACKGROUND NOTE Programme details covering Prince Philip's Visit
to~ th& Stat-e-s a-re not i(, normly announced from Canberra but from the State
capitals concerned.
